THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
19.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

ape
2024/KER/4416
CRL.MC 434/2024 2
ORDER
Dated this the 19" day of January , 2024

This Crl.M.C. under Section 482 of Cr.P.C., is filed by
the sole accused in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali
Police Station, Ernakulam, registered under Sections 354
and 354A of IPC, for quashing Annexure- Al FIR.

2. The prosecution allegation is that = on
20.11.2023, at about 3 p.m., the accused, who is a doctor
in Appollo Hospital, Karukutty, Ernakulam District, tried to
sexually abuse the 1* respondent in the treatment room of
that hospital.

3. When the matter is taken up for consideration,
learned counsel for the petitioner submitted that the
matter stands settled between the petitioner and the 1*
respondent/defacto complainant. The defacto complainant
entered appearance through counsel, and submitted that

iiseatea
2024/KER/4416
CRL.MC 434/2024 3

the matter stands settled. Annexures-AlII is the affidavit
filed by her endorsing the settlement. She has no intention
to proceed with the prosecution, and she has no objection
in quashing Annexure- Al FIR in Crime No.130 of 2024 of
Angamali Police Station, Ernakulam.

4. On _ instructions, learned Public Prosecutor
submitted that the matter is settled and he produced
signed statement of the 1* respondent. In that statement
also, she has stated that she is not intending to proceed
with the prosecution, and she has no objection in quashing
Annexure- Al FIR in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali
Police Station, Ernakulam.

5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose
would be served by continuing the prosecution against the
petitioner.

6. In the light of the principles laid down by the
Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another;
[(2012) 10 SCC 303)], and State of Madhya Pradesh v.

Elz pears
2024/KER/4416
CRL.MC 434/2024 4
Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court
is of the view that the proceedings against the petitioner
can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the
dispute is purely personal in nature and no public interest
is involved in it.
In the result, this Crl.MC is allowed, and Annexure- Al
FIR in Crime No.130 of 2024 of Angamali Police Station,
Ernakulam, stands quashed.
Sd/-
SOPHY THOMAS
JUDGE
